unnormalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra Suspended Due to Heavy Rainfall.
normalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra Suspended Due to Heavy Rainfall.

unnormalised: Due to incessant heavy rainfall, the Vaishno Devi Yatra has been temporarily suspended, officials said on 18/07/2024. The situation is being constantly monitored. Chopper services from Katra to Sanjichhat have also been put on hold. Pilgrims are advised to check weather updates before planning their trip. The shrine board has also issued helpline no. 1800-180-7198 for any assistance.
normalised: Due to incessant heavy rainfall, the Vaishno Devi Yatra has been temporarily suspended, officials said on eighteenth july two thousand and twenty four. The situation is being constantly monitored. Chopper services from Katra to Sanjichhat have also been put on hold. Pilgrims are advised to check weather updates before planning their trip. The shrine board has also issued helpline number one eight zero zero one eight zero seven one nine eight for any assistance.

unnormalised: "Safety of the yatris is our top priority," said Mr. Ramesh Kumar, CEO of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board. "We're keeping a close eye on the situation, and yatra will resume as soon as the weather improves. Yatris currently en route are being safely accommodated in the bhawan area with free langar and blankets." Local reports suggest around 5,000 yatris are stranded.
normalised: "Safety of the yatris is our top priority," said Mister Ramesh Kumar, C-E-O of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board. "We are keeping a close eye on the situation, and yatra will resume as soon as the weather improves. Yatris currently en route are being safely accommodated in the bhawan area with free langar and blankets." Local reports suggest around five thousand yatris are stranded.

unnormalised: Authorities are coordinating with the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) for possible evacuation if the situation doesn't improve by 20/07/2024. For updated information, yatris can also check the official website, www.maavaishnodevi.org. Let's all pray for better weather conditions and a safe yatra for everyone!
